At Sat, 25 Oct 2008 18:56:59 -0000,
"o.lalonde" <o.lalonde@...> wrote:
>
> Nevermind, I got it to compile using the Maven skip test argument... I
> launched the binary and heritrix is now listening on localhost:8080. I
> hope everything works smoothly from there :)

It might be worth examining the test output & determining what the
problem is with the compile. It looks like you can see the output in
/home/sysk/Desktop/heritrix2/commons/target/surefire-reports


> On another note, here is the outpout of foreground_heritrix... looks
> like there is an error in the script.
>
> sysk@sysk-ubuntu:~/Desktop/dist/heritrix-2.0.2-SNAPSHOT$
> ./bin/foreground_heritrix -a admin
> WARNING: $HERITRIX_HOME/conf/jmxremote.password not found.
> WARNING: Disabling remote JMX.
> [: 140: ==: unexpected operator
> [: 140: ==: unexpected operator
> [: 140: ==: unexpected operator
> [: 140: ==: unexpected operator
> 2008-10-25 18:53:31.862::INFO:  Logging to STDERR via
> org.mortbay.log.StdErrLog
> 2008-10-25 18:53:32.168::INFO:  jetty-6.0.2
> 2008-10-25 18:53:32.520::INFO:  Extract
> jar:file:/home/sysk/Desktop/dist/heritrix-2.0.2-SNAPSHOT/lib/webui-2.0.1.war!/
> to /tmp/Jetty_localhost_8080___/webapp
> 2008-10-25 18:53:39.002::INFO:  Started SocketConnector @ localhost:8080
> Heritrix version: 2.0.2-SNAPSHOT-20081025.142802

Ubuntu ships with /bin/sh linked to /bin/dash, a minimal shell lacking
bash shell extensions. A lot of people write shell scripts with bash
extensions but which have #!/bin/sh as the first line of the script,
which works only if /bin/sh links to /bin/bash.. Change the first line
of the bin/foreground_heritrix script to #!/bin/bash and it should
work. Also you should file a bug report at
<http://webteam.archive.org/jira/secure/Dashboard.jspa>

-Erik

--Multipart_Sat_Oct_25_14:56:01_2008-1
